publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-309# Phil Gallie: SMART Project—That the Parliament recognises the importance of Scottish popular music in respect of job creation, revenue earning and culture; welcomes the SMART (School of Music and Recording Technology) Project, which is designed to ensure that the various talents required to maintain the music industry are developed to the highest of standards; expects that the Scottish Arts Council will honour its share of funding commitment to the project, and asks that the Scottish Executive gives its full support.
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Mr Murray Tosh*, David McLetchie*
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) David Mundell*

S1M-309# Phil Gallie: SMART Project—That the Parliament recognises the importance of Scottish popular music in respect of job creation, revenue earning and culture; welcomes the SMART (School of Music and Recording Technology) Project, which is designed to ensure that the various talents required to maintain the music industry are developed to the highest of standards; expects that the Scottish Arts Council will honour its share of funding commitment to the project, and asks that the Scottish Executive gives its full support. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, David McLetchie, David Mundell
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Mr Nick Johnston*
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-309# Phil Gallie: SMART Project—That the Parliament recognises the importance of Scottish popular music in respect of job creation, revenue earning and culture; welcomes the SMART (School of Music and Recording Technology) Project, which is designed to ensure that the various talents required to maintain the music industry are developed to the highest of standards; expects that the Scottish Arts Council will honour its share of funding commitment to the project, and asks that the Scottish Executive gives its full support. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, David McLetchie, David Mundell, Mr Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Mary Scanlon*, Mr David Davidson*, Phil Gallie*

S1M-309# Phil Gallie: SMART Project—That the Parliament recognises the importance of Scottish popular music in respect of job creation, revenue earning and culture; welcomes the SMART (School of Music and Recording Technology) Project, which is designed to ensure that the various talents required to maintain the music industry are developed to the highest of standards; expects that the Scottish Arts Council will honour its share of funding commitment to the project, and asks that the Scottish Executive gives its full support. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, David McLetchie, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Fiona McLeod, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Cathy Jamieson
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Alex Neil*, Margaret Jamieson*

S1M-309# Phil Gallie: SMART Project—That the Parliament recognises the importance of Scottish popular music in respect of job creation, revenue earning and culture; welcomes the SMART (School of Music and Recording Technology) Project, which is designed to ensure that the various talents required to maintain the music industry are developed to the highest of standards; expects that the Scottish Arts Council will honour its share of funding commitment to the project, and asks that the Scottish Executive gives its full support. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, David McLetchie, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Fiona McLeod, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Alex Neil, Margaret Jamieson

S1M-309# Phil Gallie: SMART Project—That the Parliament recognises the importance of Scottish popular music in respect of job creation, revenue earning and culture; welcomes the SMART (School of Music and Recording Technology) Project, which is designed to ensure that the various talents required to maintain the music industry are developed to the highest of standards; expects that the Scottish Arts Council will honour its share of funding commitment to the project, and asks that the Scottish Executive gives its full support. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, David McLetchie, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Fiona McLeod, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Alex Neil, Margaret Jamieson
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Alex Fergusson*
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Michael Russell*

S1M-309# Phil Gallie: SMART Project—That the Parliament recognises the importance of Scottish popular music in respect of job creation, revenue earning and culture; welcomes the SMART (School of Music and Recording Technology) Project, which is designed to ensure that the various talents required to maintain the music industry are developed to the highest of standards; expects that the Scottish Arts Council will honour its share of funding commitment to the project, and asks that the Scottish Executive gives its full support. Supported by: Mr Murray Tosh, David McLetchie, David Mundell, Nick Johnston, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Fiona McLeod, Mary Scanlon, Mr David Davidson, Cathy Jamieson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Alex Neil, Margaret Jamieson, Alex Fergusson, Michael Russell
S1M-309# SMART Project (lodged on 19 November 1999) Pauline McNeill*
